seniority_level.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Senior Data Engineer' and requires 5+ years of experience, which aligns with senior level in data engineering roles.

job_family.evidence: Job title is 'Senior Data Engineer' and responsibilities focus on ETL, data pipelines, and data modeling — core data engineering functions.

sub_specialty.evidence: Primary tools mentioned include Apache Airflow (batch orchestration), SQL, and ETL processes. Kafka is mentioned but not emphasized as primary focus; batch processing is more central to described duties.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of managing people, mentoring, or technical leadership responsibilities. Role focuses on individual execution of pipelines and data models.

primary_cloud.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'AWS cloud services' as a required skill, with no other cloud platforms referenced.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud providers (Azure, GCP) are mentioned in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Mentions both Kafka (streaming) and Apache Airflow (batch), indicating a hybrid processing environment.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Explicitly lists 'Apache Airflow' as a required tool, placing it in the Airflow-like orchestrator category.

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions both data lakes (via Hadoop, S3 implied by AWS) and data modeling/schema development, suggesting a mixed storage environment with both lake and warehouse patterns.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as Denver, CO with onsite work model, implying regional restriction (same state/region).

timezone_focus.evidence: Location is Denver, CO (US Mountain Time), and no global or APAC/EU teams mentioned — implies Americas timezone focus.

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite work model and specific Denver, CO location imply relocation is required for non-local candidates.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Pass 1 extraction states 'visa_sponsorship_stated: not_mentioned' — no indication of H1B sponsorship offered.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visa support; 'must be resident' and full-time onsite role imply OPT/CPT not supported.

citizenship_required.evidence: Pass 1 extraction indicates 'residency_requirement: must_be_resident' — implies work authorization required, but no citizenship or green card requirement stated.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent position with benefits (401k, health insurance, stock) strongly implies W2 employment.

benefits_level.evidence: Extensive benefits listed including equity (stock purchase), learning budget (Live Better U), PTO, parental leave, disability, and more — meets comprehensive threshold.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'contribute to the future of data engineering' and 'drive innovation' but no specific career tracks, levels, or promotion paths are defined.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions 'collaborate with cross-functional teams' and working in a 'dynamic team' — implies peer learning but no formal mentorship program or assigned mentor.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression paths in the job description or Pass 1 extraction.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within the company.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, architect, or specialist tracks. Too vague to confidently assign any track.

requirement_strictness.evidence: All skills listed are under 'must have' with no 'nice to have' skills. Minimum 5+ years experience and specific tech stack required.

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering responsibilities: ETL, pipelines, data modeling, and governance — no hybrid or multi-role expectations.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skills required (Python, SQL, Spark, Airflow, AWS) are standard for a senior data engineer with 5+ years experience — no unrealistic or inflated expectations.
